sen.j: 時代祭（じだいまつり）は、京都、平安神宮の祭り。
sen.e: Jidai matsuri, or Festival of the Ages, is a festival for celebrating the establishement of Heian Jingu Shrine in Kyoto.

sen.j: その創建を祝うためのものであり京都三大祭りの一つである。
sen.e: The festival is one of the three most renowned festivals in Kyoto.

sen.j: 神宮の管理と保存のための市民組織として、平安講社が作られ、「祭り」はその記念事業として始まった。
sen.e: Heian Kosha was established as a civil organization for the management and preservation of the shrine, and the festival was started as a project to celebrate anniversary.

sen.j: その中で祭りを盛大にするため、東京奠都以前の京都の風俗を、時代を遡って行列を行うことが提案されたので、この祭りが「時代祭り」と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: An idea to augument the mood of the festival was that having a procession in Kyoto styles representing each historical period, from the newest to the oldest, prior to the transfer of capital to Tokyo; and the festival started to be called "Jidai matsuri," or Festival of the Ages.

sen.j: 初回は、創建されたばかりの平安神宮への参拝として明治28年（1895年）10月25日に行われ、その次の回からは、「祭神である桓武天皇と孝明天皇の二柱の御霊が、住まいであった御所から街の繁栄を見ながら行列のお供を従へて神宮へ行く」形となった。
sen.e: The first festival was held on October 25, 1895 as a worship to the newly built Heian Jingu Shrine; from the next year, the festival took a form in which "the two great spirits of Emperor Kanmu and Emperor Komei, who are the objects of worship, visit the shrine from Kyoto Imperial House, which used to be the residence, with a long line of attendants following in the procession, enjoying the view of the flourishing towns.

The first festival was held on October 25, 1895 to worship the newly built Heian Jingu Shrine; from the following year, the festival took a form in which two great spirits of Emperor Kanmu and Emperor Komei, who are the objects of worship, visit the shrine from the Kyoto Imperial Household, which used to be their residence, with a long line of attendants following in the procession, enjoying the view of the flourishing towns.

sen.j: 開催日も桓武天皇が長岡京から都を移し新しい都に入ったとされる日、すなわち京都の誕生日とも言える10月22日となった。
sen.e: The date of the festival was decided to be the day Emperor Kanmu was believed to enter Kyoto, that is, on October 22, therefore, it is the "birthday" of Kyoto, the city he decided to be the capital moving from Nagaokakyo.

sen.j: 祭り自体は10月15日の参役宣状祭（行列の役柄任命）から、23日の後日祭までの期間行われる。
sen.e: The festival starts on October 15, with Sanyaku senjosai ceremony, in which the roles in the procession are declared, and ends with the closing ceremony which is held on October 23.

sen.j: 行列は7つの時代、18の列でそれぞれに時代を再現した衣装や道具を身につけた人々で行われ、最初は明治維新、ついで江戸時代、安土桃山時代、吉野、鎌倉時代、藤原、延暦と時代を遡って続く。
sen.e: The procession consists of performers who are dressed and have instruments and objects, forming18 sections representing seven periods, starting with Meiji Restoration, followed by Edo, Azuchi-Momoyama, Yoshino, Kamakura, Fujiwara eras, ending with Enryaku era.

sen.e: The drum and bundle corps for the procession of Meiji Restoration and Restoration royalists, which are at the front part of the Jidai procession, are conscripted farmer army of loyalists, Yamaguni platoon used to be composed of actual veterans from the first festival in 1895 to sometime in Taisho era.
